flixel.system.frontEnds.WatchFrontEnd

type
class

Constructor

new()
Just needed to create an instance.

Instance Methods

inline add(AnyObject : Dynamic, VariableName : String, ?DisplayName : String) : Void

parameters
AnyObject A reference to any object in your game, e.g. Player or Robot or this.
VariableName The name of the variable you want to watch, in quotes, as a string: e.g. "speed" or "health".
DisplayName Optional, display your own string instead of the class name + variable name: e.g. "enemy count".
Add a variable to the watch list in the debugger. This lets you see the value of the variable all the time.

inline addMouse() : Void

Add the mouse coords to the watch window. Useful for quickly getting coordinates for object placement during prototyping!

inline addQuick(Name : String, NewValue : Dynamic) : Void

parameters
Name The name of the quickWatch entry, for example "mousePressed".
NewValue The new value for this entry, for example FlxG.mouse.pressed.
Add or update a quickWatch entry to the watch list in the debugger. Extremely useful when called in update() functions when there doesn't exist a variable for a value you want to watch - so you won't have to create one.

inline remove(AnyObject : Dynamic, ?VariableName : String) : Void

parameters
AnyObject A reference to any object in your game, e.g. Player or Robot or this.
VariableName The name of the variable you want to watch, in quotes, as a string: e.g. "speed" or "health".
Remove a variable from the watch list in the debugger. Don't pass a Variable Name to remove all watched variables for the specified object.

inline removeMouse() : Void

Removes the mouse coords from the watch window.

inline removeQuick(Name : String) : Void

parameters
Name The name of the quickWatch entry you want to remove.
Remove a quickWatch entry from the watch list of the debugger.
